subject: Re: [junit] JUnit works great in IDE, how do I run it from a shell?
msgSnippet: ... With good reason. ant-junit.jar contains the ANT/JUnit integration classes. It is not JUnit, so softlinking junit.jar and ant-junit.jar will not work. You
messageBody:
Pat Farrell wrote:
> Daryl Richter wrote:
> > Make sure that you have junit.jar in your $ANT_HOME/lib directory.
>
> I created a $ANT_HOME environment variable, pointed it to
> ANT_HOME=/opt/netbeans-5.0/ide6/ant
>
> and did a softlink for junit.jar pointing to the
> ant-junit.jar in the $ANT_HOME/lib
>
> So far, no change, still complains

With good reason. ant-junit.jar contains the ANT/JUnit integration
classes. It is not JUnit, so softlinking junit.jar and ant-junit.jar
will not work.

You want a link in $ANT_HOME/lib to junit.jar and to leave ant-junit.jar
as it is.
